importantArticles.headline: Shares of social media companies like Instagram and Facebook owner  Meta Platforms Reddit  and Pinterest were rising Friday on the back of strong earnings from  Alphabet  The advertising heavyweight’s latest financials were a reassuring sign for companies that rely on digital ad revenue.  The Google and YouTube parent’s first-quarter print on Thursday highlighted growth in its advertising business.  Alphabet also cited strength in its YouTube ads business, which rose to $8.9 billion from $8.1 billion in 2024.
importantArticles.title: Reddit, Meta, and Pinterest Stocks Rise. How Alphabet’s Earnings Are Giving Them a Boost.

This initiative, part of a broader trend of tech advancements, might have contributed to investor optimism, reflecting broader tech stock gains seen in the Nasdaq index, which rose alongside other major indexes amidst significant...

importantArticles.headline: Meta is using AI technology to search for kids who are lying about their age on Instagram in order to bypass safeguards, the company announced on Monday. When Meta finds an account that it suspects belongs to a teen, the platform will enroll them into a restricted Teen Account, even if the account lists an adult birthday. importantArticles.title: Instagram is using AI to find teens lying about their age and restricting their accounts

importantArticles.headline: Meta Platforms CEO Mark Zuckerberg testified this week at a high-stakes trial in Washington where the U.S. Federal Trade Commission is seeking to unwind Meta's acquisitions of prized assets Instagram and WhatsApp.  Zuckerberg in 2018 floated the idea of spinning off Instagram amid mounting pressure on Big Tech from antitrust regulators, in a sign of how seriously he took the threat of precisely the type of claims Meta now faces.  Seeking to explain messages in which he worried that Instagram was a competitive threat, Zuckerberg said the app's camera was simply better than camera features Meta had developed.

importantArticles.headline: WASHINGTON (Reuters) -Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg considered spinning off popular photo-sharing app Instagram in 2018 over concerns about the growing risk of antitrust scrutiny, according to a document shown at a trial in Washington on Tuesday.  The document was shown during Zuckerberg's second day of testimony at the high-stakes trial, in which the U.S. Federal Trade Commission is seeking to unwind Meta's acquisitions of prized assets Instagram and WhatsApp.  "I wonder if we should consider the extreme step of spinning Instagram out as a separate company," Zuckerberg said in the memo.
importantArticles.title: Meta's Zuckerberg eyed Instagram spinoff amid antitrust scrutiny, document shows

importantArticles.headline: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg once considered separating Instagram from its parent company due to worries about antitrust litigation, according to an email shown Tuesday on the second day of an antitrust trial alleging Meta illegally monopolized the social media market.  In the 2018 email, Zuckerberg wrote that he was beginning to wonder if “spinning Instagram out” would be the only way to accomplish important goals, as big-tech companies grow.  Asked Tuesday by attorney Daniel Matheson, who is leading the antitrust case for the Federal Trade Commission, which incidence in corporate history he had in mind, Zuckerberg responded: “I'm not sure what I had in mind then.”
importantArticles.title: Meta CEO Zuckerberg considered spinning off Instagram in 2018 over antitrust worries, email says

importantArticles.headline: Mark Zuckerberg defended Meta's (META) past acquisitions in court, arguing Instagram and WhatsApp strengthened competition rather than stifled it.
